On Tue, 26 Nov 2002, Vikas Malla wrote:
> Right now, most of the unit test creation is done without any tool using
> junit+cactus+httpunit. My point of contention is the case in which for
> every change I make to my class, I need to incorporate that change into
> the test class, if it is required. How can that be minimized?

It sounds like you aren't doing test-first programming. If you were, then
you'd only have to change your class when a test failed. When you want to
add a feature, you write a test, run it, and fix any code that breaks.


Erik
